<<<api>>>: ImageIO.write and ImageIO.read
<<<code>>>: 
Server side:
```
while(true){
    Socket sock=s.accept();
    System.out.println("Connection");
    OutputStream out=sock.getOutputStream();
    while(!socket.isClosed()){
        BufferedImage img=//get image
        ImageIO.write(img, "jpg", out);
        out.flush();
        Thread.sleep(100);
    }
    System.out.println("Closed");
}
```
Client side:
```
Socket s=new Socket(InetAddress.getByName("localhost"), 1998);
InputStream in=s.getInputStream();
while(!s.isClosed()){
    BufferedImage img=ImageIO.read(ImageIO.createImageInputStream(in));
    if(img==null)//this is what happens on the SECOND image
    else // do something useful with the image
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: The problem is that ImageIO.read() is not designed to handle multiple images from a single stream. It reads until it finds the end of the stream, which is not what you want. You need to flush the OutputStream after each write on the server side. On the client side, you should use ImageIO.createImageInputStream() to create an ImageInputStream, and then use ImageIO.read() to read from that. This way, ImageIO.read() will only read one image at a time.
